response:
1: When you think about the environmental impact of software, who comes to
mind as responsible for it? And why did that person or group come to mind?
Software Developers - they seem to have the most control (at least
superficially)

3: In your experience, who is currently making decisions about the
environmental impact of software? Is it the right set of people?
It's mostly executives within software companies in an ostensible response
to customer demand (or where they think the customer is going) - it's also
the data center companies

3: What barriers have you or your organization encountered when trying to
address software's environmental impact?
deprioritization vs "mission critical" work like trying to meet customer
feature demands. perceived lack of control if all of the software runs on
hyperscale data centers we don't operate. lack of ability to monetize if
there is a green premium for something (like a cleaner but more costly data
center region)
